li.p: Create TCPIP servers in the Service Manager and mark the algorithm as round robin for each server. This is required in 3-4 servers, on which you need to execute round robin algorithm.
(Optional) You may add FIXEDLENGTH modifier to apply restriction on variable values.

Example: If the text in the template is $(FIXEDLENGTH)(20,rightpadding,0,lefttrimming)[LastCost], then the LastCost variable (of length 20) is padded by 0 on the right side, and is trimmed of any space on the left.
Other variations of this modifier can be used in the template to restrict or alter the value of notification variable as required. For more information on this feature, see .
In the notification template, Custom behaviour parameter should be set to DVS. This ensures that the TCP/IP notification works in a round robin manner. For generic, set this parameter to none.
Create a notification profile in SM for the notification channel and notification type.
